p: Where control of invasive species is being considered, genomic approaches can help in defining units for eradication and risks of reinvasion once eradication is achieved (Fig. 1). At present, markers such as microsatellites are often used for defining movement patterns among populations of invasive pest mammals (e.g. Hampton et al. 2004; Abdelkrim et al. 2005; Berry et al. 2012; Adams et al. 2014). With the use of genomics approaches, managers should become much more confident of likely movement patterns and reinvasion potential as local movement patterns can be tracked much more accurately than in the past.
